intro: Hemitelia crenata, commonly known as the serrated hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a serrated edge, contributing to its common name. Hemitelia crenata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
